intro: Hieracium limbifloccum, commonly known as the fluffcup, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Hieracium limbifloccum is often found in the eastern and central United States.
